document.topic_text: SJ_GR850 St. Joseph, MO Wed Aug 10, 2016 USDA-MO Dept Ag Market News Daily National Grain Market Summary Grain and soybean bids were mixed. The weak U.S. dollar lend some support to the grains. The markets are waiting for Friday�s report to give the market direction. Wheat was mostly 1-5 cents higher. Corn was 4 cents lower to 1 cent higher. Sorghum was 1 cent higher. Soybeans were 5-6 cents lower. DATE CHANGE YEAR AGO TRUCK BIDS: 08/10/16 08/09/16 08/12/15 Wheat: Kansas City (HRW ORD) 3.51 3/4-3.56 3/4 up 1 3/4 4.75 1/4 Minneapolis 5.01 1/4 up 3 5.24 1/2 Portland (SWW) 4.90-4.95 up 3-5 5.42 1/4-5.47 1/4 St. Louis (SRW) 3.96-4.06 up4-dn 1 4.22-4.77 Corn, US No 2 Yellow: Kansas City 3.07 1/2-3.12 1/2 up 1/4 3.54 1/4-3.57 1/4 Minneapolis 2.92 1/2 dn 2 3/4 3.12 1/4 So. Iowa 3.11 1/2-3.15 1/2 dn 1/4-1 3/4 3.41 1/4-3.45 1/4 Omaha 2.97-3.02 up 1 3.48-3.49 Soybeans, US No 1 Yellow: Kansas City 9.97 1/4 dn 5 3/4 9.70 Minneapolis 9.89 1/4 dn 5 3/4 8.95 So. Iowa 10.10 1/4-10.12 1/4 dn 5 3/4 8.91-9.55 Cent. Il Processor 10.12 1/4-10.24 1/4 dn 5 3/4 9.60-9.85 FUTURES: Kansas City (Sep) Wheat 4.11 3/4 up 1 3/4 4.75 1/4 Minneapolis (Sep) Wheat 5.01 1/4 up 3 5.09 1/2 Chicago (Sep) Wheat 4.21 3/4 up 4 3/4 4.92 1/2 Chicago (Sep) Corn 3.22 1/2 up 1/4 3.57 1/4 Chicago (Nov) Soybeans 9.82 1/4 dn 5 3/4 9.10 *EXPORT BIDS: Barge bids out of the Port of New Orleans, or Rail out of the North Texas Gulf. Bids per bushel, except sorghum per cwt. US 1 HRW Wheat Ord Protein: 3.91 3/4-4.26 3/4 up 1 3/4 4.80 1/4-5.10 1/2 US 2 Soft Red Winter Wheat 4.41 3/4-4.46 3/4 up 4 3/4 5.07 1/4-5.08 1/4 US 2 Corn Barge 3.79 1/2-3.84 1/2 dn 4 3/4 3.94 1/4-3.97 1/4 US 2 Sorghum Rail 6.75-7.01 3/4 up 1-3/4 8.35 3/4-8.53 1/2 Barge 6.12 1/2-6.92 3/4 up 1-3/4 8.09-8.53 1/2 US 2 Yellow Soybeans Barge 10.87 1/4-10.90 1/4 dn 6 3/4 9.90-9.93 SOURCE: USDA- MO Dept OF Ag Market News Service, St. Joseph, MO Baldemar Ortiz, Market Reporter (816)676-7000 www.ams.usda.gov/LSMarketNews 1540C bro
document.post: SJ_GR850 St. Joseph, MO Wed Aug 10, 2016 USDA-MO Dept Ag Market News Daily National Grain Market Summary Grain and soybean bids were mixed. The weak U.S. dollar lend some support to the grains. The markets are waiting for Friday�s report to give the market direction. Wheat was mostly 1-5 cents higher. Corn was 4 cents lower to 1 cent higher. Sorghum was 1 cent higher. Soybeans were 5-6 cents lower.
